Modkills:
None, and let's keep it that way.

House Rules (borrowed shamelessly from JereIC)

The Mod
1. Hi! I'm the mod. How's it going?
2. Everything written by the me will be in blue. No other text in post messages should appear in blue. If you post anything in blue (other than your signature) it will be edited to a different color, and a player may be mod-killed if they are pretending I wrote it.
3. You may paraphrase communications you have with me. Directly quoting anything I wrote to you is prohibited, and a player may be mod-killed for doing it.
4. If you need to get my attention on a matter, you can post in the thread in bold, or send me a PM.
5. As the mod, I am always right and often accurate. If you see me mess up, please let me know.

Posting During Day, Night, and Twilight
6. During the day and twilight, surviving players may only discuss this game in this thread. All other communication with other players is prohibited.
7. No small, invisible, or encrypted text.
8. Once I lock the thread and declare night, you may communicate with other players only if your role PM explicitly says you may.
9. If you are killed or lynched, you may make one short "bah!" post.

Voting and Lynches
10. Only votes that are in bold and appear substantially in the format Vote: That Guy will be counted.
11. Unvotes are optional, but if you do it also must be bolded.
12. A lynch occurs when a player receives a majority of possible votes (half the number of the surviving players rounded down plus one). Once a player is lynched, the game enters twilight and no further votes or unvotes will be counted. Night occurs when I declare the lynch and lock the thread.
13. You may vote for no lynch. If a number of these votes make it impossible to secure a lynch by the above-stated majority, the day will end without a lynch. This is half the number of surviving players rounded up.

Deadlines
14. Days (including the first) will have default deadline of two weeks. A day deadline can be extended one week by player request.
15. Nights will have a default deadline of 48 hours, or 72 hours if any part of the night will occur over a weekend. A night deadline can be extended 24 hours by player request.
16. If a day deadline passes and no one has a majority of votes, the day ends with no lynch. If a night deadline passes and you have not made a night choice, you will take no night action that night.

Activity
17. If you will be V/LA for more than three days, please post in bold or send me a PM.
18. You are expected to post at least once every three days. If you do not, I will send you a prod, which you must respond to by posting in this thread within 48 hours. If you do not respond to a prod, or have to be prodded more than twice, you will probably be replaced.

Ok, Let's Get Started
19. In addition to these rules, all site-wide rules apply.
20. Very soon, if not already, you should have received a role PM. This game is SEMI-OPEN, which means I will reveal all of the roles that can possibly be in this game. This is NOT a promise regarding role distribution, for instance a role may be completely absent from the game or there may be copies of the same role. This IS a promise that any role not listed here will not be part of the game.
21. Please PM me to confirm (this may be the 3rd time you've read that).
22. Good luck, and have fun!

Role PMs:

VT
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no particular powers, which is quite alright because you enjoy sleeping at night anyway!

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Cop
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Cop. You like to snoop around. At night, you may PM me the name of one player who you want to check out, and I'll let you know if they are up to no good. I will only use terms of Innocent, Guilty, or No Result.

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Doctor
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Doctor. You like to stop bad things from happening. You are also very good at treating burns and boo-boos. In fact, you even majored and earned a degree in burn/boo-boo treating. At night you may protect one player in the game from one nightkill.

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Vigilante
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Vigilante. You like to take the law into your own hands. You are tired of the bureaucracy and all its red tape, so you've borrowed 10 gallons of gasoline and a lighter torch. At night you may target one player in the game for a nightkill.

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Innocent Child
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Innocent Child. You appear non-threatening. In fact, innocence oozes out of your every pore. At the start of D1, the moderator will announce you as an innocent child, confirming you as town-aligned.

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Mason
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Mason, along with your partner(s) [PLAYER] and [PLAYER]. You are very close-knit friends. You have the same birthdays, you like to sleep over at each others houses, and you wear matching bow ties everyday. You are confirmed town to your mason partner(s) and vice versa.

In addition, you are permitted to talk to your partner(s) during pregame and at nights in this [QUICKTOPIC].

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


T Roleblocker
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Town Roleblocker. You really like boats. You could talk about boats for hours. You do talk about boats for hours, every night! Once at night, you may select a player in the game to roleblock. They will not be able to perform an action on this night if they have one.

You are pro-town, and win when all threats to the town are eliminated and at least one pro-town player is alive. Please PM me to confirm.


Goon
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Mafia Goon, along with your partner(s) [PLAYER] and [PLAYER]. You and your buddie(s) forgot your guns this game, but luckily you've found a large cache of dynamite, gunpowder, and gasoline. Each night you or one of your partner(s) may kill a player.

In addition, you are permitted to talk to your partner(s) during pregame and at nights in this [QUICKTOPIC].

You are anti-town, and win when the Mafia obtain a majority. Please PM me to confirm.


M Roleblocker
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Mafia Roleblocker, along with your partner(s) [PLAYER] and [PLAYER]. You and your buddie(s) forgot your guns this game, but luckily you've found a large cache of dynamite, gunpowder, and gasoline. Each night you or one of your partner(s) may kill a player.

If killing isn't your cup of tea, you also have a little black dress and a laced bottle of whiskey. Once at night, you individually may select a player in the game to roleblock. They will not be able to perform an action on this night if they have one. You cannot block and kill in the same night.

In addition, you are permitted to talk to your partner(s) during pregame and at nights in this [QUICKTOPIC].

You are anti-town, and win when the Mafia obtain a majority. Please PM me to confirm.


Godfather
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are a Mafia Godfather, along with your partner(s) [PLAYER] and [PLAYER]. You and your buddie(s) forgot your guns this game, but luckily you've found a large cache of dynamite, gunpowder, and gasoline. Each night you or one of your partner(s) may kill a player.

In addition, you are permitted to talk to your partner(s) during pregame and at nights in this [QUICKTOPIC].

It is worth noting that you live in an exquisite mansion, have a swimming pool filled with money, and own a false identity. The police do not know your real identity, and they also enjoy the barbeques you host at your mansion and money-polo games in your pool. As such, you individually appear innocent to Cop investigations.

You are anti-town, and win when the Mafia obtain a majority. Please PM me to confirm.


Arsonist
Welcome, [PLAYER], to Mini 1408: Playing with Fire! You are an Arsonist. You like to burn things. At night, you may either douse a target in gasoline OR you may burn every target you have previously doused, killing them all. You cannot douse and kill in the same night.

In addition, you must choose pre-game between having either Investigation Immunity or a 1-shot Bulletproof.

You are a 3rd party, and only win when all other players are dead or if you are one of the last two alive. Please PM me to confirm.

qwints wrote:Mastin, I don't buy scum xisq trying to draw an imagined doc's protection off zar when there's an innocent child in the game.
As scum, you can't get the doctor to be off of the innocent child, but you can do vice-versa. If your plan as scum is to nightkill an unconfirmed player, what do you do? Try to get the doctor to where they technically should already be?

...Or try to make sure they're not on a specific player you want dead?

It's hard to convince the doctor to protect a player. It's incredibly easy to convince the doctor not to protect a specific player.

Basically, to ensure the nightkill goes through, they need to make sure that the doctor is not on their target. Technically, the doctor should be on the innocent child, but any efforts to ensure that the doctor actually IS will backfire and make it so that they aren't. Thereby increasing the likelihood of a non-innocent-child-kill failing.

qwints wrote:You also have scum-xisi doing very little to influence a deadlocked town as the deadline approached.
Imagine you're scum. You don't know Rondar is a cop.
You see a divided town. Now think that through. Which is more beneficial?
-Get a lynch. Town gets information. That information helps them better locate scum.
-Don't get a lynch. Town gets no information. The next day, the division from the previous day phase continues, only a whole lot worse.

To see this in full effect, you need not look further than Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Legacy. Town divided over a zabriel lynch. Did scum push that mislynch through? No, they did not. They let it fail, so that in the next day phase, the division would continue.

Best yet, because you avoided hopping onto the mislynch, you don't get suspicion from it!

Plus, as a final bonus, a no-lynch throws the town onto evens. The town must therefore no-lynch to off-balance that somewhere down the line, which gives the scum one extra nightkill. If the town refuses to no-lynch, then that gives one extra body to be mislynched.

So tell me again, what's the town motive in not taking a stance?

In theory, it could have scum motive, in that it could make it so that people drop you off of their radar while they wait.
In practice, they never, EVER do. If anything, every day of "stalling" is another day their suspicion GROWS, rather than shrinks. It doesn't work as a scum tactic at all.
In theory, it could have a scum motive, in that you push the case right next to deadline, not giving people enough time to process it. It makes it so that the lynch either fails (so you can save it for tomorrow) or is rushed (as people don't have the time to pick it apart).
In practice, this only makes it look bad. (See also: what Xisi did just before night, shining suspicion onto Zar.) The player catches flak for the late case, and it's dissected overnight. All of the flaws present in the case are exposed, and the person making the case is either ignored or lynched. (Depending on whether their case is seen as VIish or scummy.)

In theory, there is scum motive.
In practice, cut the crap; there is none.

"Not pushing", not "stalling". Two are completely different things. You can be pushing a lynch yet "stalling" a case, you can be chugging out case after case yet still not be pushing a lynch, you can be stalling AND not pushing a lynch, and you can be not-stalling while also pushing a lynch.

The two may have some overlap, but they're not even close to the same concept. You can push a lynch without a case. You can create a case without pushing a lynch. Ideally, you want to push a lynch with a case, and it is, in fact, scummy to neither push a case nor push a lynch--but it's MUCH more for the latter than the former.

Spoiler:
In post 16, mastin2 wrote:
In post 15, Katsuki wrote:
In post 0, mastin2 wrote:Strong-arm Arrogance works really well short-term, but it's self-destructive in the long-term; you need to negotiate/reason/persuade, not threaten and force.


It feels like this actually applies more to previous metas rather than the one today... Lately it seems you get nowhere without bashing people's heads in.

tl;dr, threatening and forcing is the way to go nowadays.
Short-term, yes. Strongarming your way through a lynch by threatening people and forcing yourself onto them aggressively and arrogantly will get you listened to, for a phase or two. The earlier in the game, the better. People think you're good, so they follow you.

Long-term, though...if you don't have the results to back it up, they'll turn on you. They'll either ignore you even if you're right (reverse-7-for-7; you were wrong before, so you're wrong now), or call you scummy for pushing mislynch after mislynch--justifiably so, as looking at an overall picture and seeing a player consistently push mislynches is a decently-strong way to find scum more often than not. They'll realize that you never really had any solid reasoning to push said mislynches, either. You just forced them through with your attitude alone.

And any hope you have of being listened to is lost.

That's why in the long-term, you can't afford to strongarm. People need to see you came from a good spot for why you pushed that mislynch. They need to see that you had good reasons, reasons which could have been right but were proven wrong. They need to see you addressing how you were wrong, and why THIS time you're right. You need to have that persuasiveness. Though it's not impossible to strongarm your way through, it's incredibly difficult. Even if you suddenly switch tactics from arrogant strongaming to reasonable negotiation, your previous strongarm tactics are going to make you look suspect, and furthermore, you'll catch attention for the sudden switch in tactics.

Hence, why it works really well short-term, but in the long-term is incredibly self-destructive. I've been in enough games to know that most town players don't really think that far ahead. The arrogant and abrasive players expect to be dead within a few night-phases, so they don't really anticipate living long enough for their tactics to be a problem.

However, far too often, they DO live long enough for the town's paranoia to kick in, at which time, they've lost all semblance of credibility and will no longer hold as much influence over the game. Their short-term thinking means they didn't anticipate this hurdle, and now they have an uphill battle for the rest of the game to convince people they're still town (as they were originally seen as blindly), and convince people they're right (as they were originally seen as blindly).

Hence, why some long-term thinking is a necessity. If you start persuading (not forcing! not shoving your read down their throats! Legitimately persuading!^1) them from the beginning, you only get stronger as the game goes along. You'll start out weaker than those who strongarm through lynches, but over time, you'll just get better and better. People will see you've been trying to reason since the beginning, and the scum will take notice. Even if you're completely off your base, you're a threat, because you're showing solid logic and the ability to successfully negotiate, whereas a strongarm player shows very little ability to change.

In today's meta, scum can just bluntly target whoever they please, and get at least some following if they strongarm their way through. So what can a town player do to distinguish their strongarming from scum strongarming? It's not impossible, but it's incredibly difficult, as you're fighting against the very nature of human psychology.

So, the best strategy is to adapt a new approach. My suggested approach, of persuasion, of negotiating and convincing them with solid reasoning rather than throwaway pieces scattered across the game and bluntly threatening people, is the best way I can think of. It's not impossible for scum to do, but it's much harder for scum to do.

Basically--strongarming is easy for scum to continue for the whole game, but gets much harder for town.
Negotiating is hard for scum to continue for the whole game, but gets much easier for town.

Five years ago, it was of course vice-versa, with strongarming being town and negotiating being scum. But the site meta's shifted so drastically to be the opposite of that, into what I described above.

And quite frankly, I think the site would be better-off returning at least partially to the good ol' ways.





1: Essentially, look at the difference. You want Persuasion, defined as--Cause (someone) to do something through reasoning or argument, or Cause (someone) to believe something, esp. after a sustained effort; convince.

Not Coercion, defined as--Use of force or intimidation to obtain compliance.

Though the two may be similar on the surface, the two are not the same, and most players these days seem to assume they are.

A worried town gathers to discuss what to make of all the bodies piling up so recent, and the threat against it's kind citizens. As the minutes pass, they have become even more worried as one of their own has not shown up yet. Finally one man stands up to take the podium.

"Good evening everyone, I think we all know why we're here, and right now we need all the information we can get. If you have anything to share raise your hand, and I'll call on you."

Every hand in the auditorium goes up.

"You can just raise one of them, please. You, up front?"

"I've heard that the scum possess your mind, and make you become so angry that you spontaneously catch on fire."

"Thanks for sharing. And you, sir?"

"I think we should live underwater, so that they can't kill us with their mind fires."

"Right, I don't think you understand what's happening. How about you, young man?"

"There's a scum under my bed!!"

"Ok, maybe we should just focus on a plan. I think we need to be rational here, and not just start lynching one person a day, hoping they're evil-"

"Hey, that's a great plan!"

"No, I said we shouldn't..."

All of a sudden, the doors to the hall burst open. ThAdmiral rushes in, "Sorry I'm late, I was caught up."

A packet of matches falls out of his pocket.

"Now wait just a minute, I can explain."

The town gets out of their chairs and moves in on ThAdmiral. He begins walking back to the door. Before he reaches it, five people jump him, tying him up and dragging him outside. The few who remain inside hear ThAdmiral scream, "Wait! I was only lighting scented candles! I didn't kill anyone! I don't even own gasoline!" before the end. A quick search of his belongings reveals no gasoline, or scuminess for that matter.

ThAdmiral, Vanilla Townie, LEMON FRESH Day 4.

"Hey, Bacde, I've got a question."

"Fire away," Bacde said.

"Hehe, funny you should mention that."

"What do you mean?"

"Never mind. Ok, so why are some human organs so essential? If something important gets infected like your appendix, you're out of luck since you only have one of them."

"Not exactly, but continue."

"And then you look at the heart and it's so redundant! It's got like four chambers. You gotta ask, what's wrong with three chambers? What's one less chamber to your average heart? Can't you like donate some for fun or profit?"

"That's absurd. The heart needs all four chambers to pump blood. It has to pump blood from the body, to the lungs, back from the lungs, then back to the rest of the body. Four things to do, four pumps."

"Hey, how you do you know all this stuff?"

"Well," Bacde said, "I'm a doctor. I studied the circulatory system for years. If someone goes into shock, say from a severe burn, I know exactly what's happening."

"Hehe, severe burns, funny you should mention that."

"What? Why's everything I say 'Funny you should mention that'?"

"No reason, Bacde. Hey, does this rag smell like gasoline?"

"Well a little I sup-," Bacde began, stopping mid-sentence. "Oh."

Bacde, Town Doctor, HEATED DEBATE Night 4

Night 5 begins now and lasts for 48 hours - Day 6 will begin @ 11:30am EST on March 7th, 2013. This is in (expired on 2013-03-07 11:30:00). Send all actions to my PM inbox - I will not accept actions if they're not in my inbox at deadline.

Only one thing went through Xisiqomelir's mind. Abandon ship. So many of his friends had already met an untimely demise, and he wouldn't be next. He was surrounded by cold blooded killers and didn't trust anybody. Xisiqomelir quickly threw some essential supplies into a backpack and stole away into the dark of night.

As he passed by Vifam's house he saw two shadowy figures slip into the front door. Little Vifam was in trouble! Xisiqomelir couldn't just leave behind an innocent child. After gathering all of his courage, he pressed on towards the house. He could smell the scent of gasoline and knew he didn't have much time to act.

Xisiqomelir peeked inside a window and saw the back of a young boy tied to a chair, surrounded by sticks of dynamite. The shady figures were nowhere in sight. Perhaps they forgot their blowtorches? He still had time, what a stroke of luck! Xisiqomelir slipped inside the house and hurried to the side of Vifam. He started to untie the boy and patted his hair. "Don't be scared, I'll get you out of here."

Then the mop fell off Vifam's head. It wasn't Vifam at all! The child was a fake. In the doll's hands was a note that read, "We knew you'd run. You're no match for us!"

As Xisiqomelir repeatedly hit his head against the wall after reading the terrible 'match' pun, he heard the lock to the door click shut. Moments later, a molotov cocktail sailed through the window.

The fire spread across the floor lined with gasoline, and quickly reached the pile of stacked dynamite.
